p: The study was conducted on Lemnos island—in contemporary sources also spelled Limnos—Greece, occupying about 482 km 2 and biogeographically belonging to the North Aegean Sea [ 16, 17] (Fig. 1). It resides in the Prefecture of Lesvos (39° 46′–40° 02′ N, 25° 02′–25° 26′ E) [ 16, 18] and the climate of the area is the Mediterranean with mild winters, dry hot summers, and mean annual precipitation of about 500 mm [ 19, 20].
